Cutthroats, killers, thieves, and toughs prey upon the vulnerable of society. Directing their activities and keeping them in line are the duties of the gang leader. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 23 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 [Gang Leader](/NPCs.aspx?ID=964) **Source** [Gamemastery Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=22) pg. 249 **Perception** +14 **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +13, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +13, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +15, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +17, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +11, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +13, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) +15, [Underworld Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +15 **Str** +4 **Dex** +4 **Con** +2 **Int** +2 **Wis** -1 **Cha** +4 **Items** [_minor healing potion_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=186), [_+1 shortsword_](/Weapons.aspx?ID=43), [Sling](/Weapons.aspx?ID=72) (10 bullets), [Studded Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=5), [Tanglefoot Bag](/Equipment.aspx?ID=78) --- **AC** 26 **Fort** +13 **Ref** +17 **Will** +10 **HP** 104 **Deny Advantage** The gang leader isn't flat-footed to creatures of 7th level or lower that are [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22), [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39), flanking, or using surprise attack.
**Evasion** When the gang leader rolls a success on a Reflex save, they get a critical success instead.
**Surprise Attack** On the first round of combat, if the gang leader rolls [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) or [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) for initiative, creatures who haven't acted are [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) to the gang leader.
**Nimble Dodge** **Trigger** The gang leader is targeted with an attack by an attacker they can see; **Effect** The gang leader gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. --- **Speed** 30 feet **Melee** shortsword +18 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 1d6+10 piercing **Ranged** sling +18 ([Propulsive](/Traits.aspx?ID=191), [range increment 50 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)), **Damage** 1d6+8 bludgeoning **Brutal Rally** ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Linguistic](/Traits.aspx?ID=101), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) **Trigger** The gang leader rolls a critical hit against a creature; **Effect** All allies that can see the gang leader gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls until the start of the gang leader's next turn. **Gang Up** Any enemy is [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) against the gang leader's melee attacks due to flanking as long as the enemy is within melee reach of both the gang leader and one of the gang leader's allies. **Quick Draw** The gang leader Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon. **[Sneak Attack](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=34)** The gang leader deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) creatures.
Gang Structure A gang leader might run a gang, but several other NPCs in this chapter make for good gang members. A gang of significant size typically has a pyramid structure so that only a few members report directly to the boss and it's harder to link crimes directly to those in charge if someone gets arrested.
